title: Foster mum charged with murder after twins, 3, found dead in scorching 52C car
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A foster mum has been charged with murder over the deaths of three-year-old twins after they reportedly overheated in a car.

Raelynn and Payton Keyes were exposed to 52C heat inside the vehicle in Hinesville, Georgia, US, last month.

Their designated guardian Claudette Foster handed herself into police after the children's bodies were discovered, reports say.

Detectives say no-one was keeping a close eye on the pair, enabling them to get into the vehicle outside her fiancé's home.

(Image: Hinesville Police Department)

According to The Sun, Captain Tracey Howard said: "The foster parent for the children was the first person to call 911.

"Other members of the family, to include the person who resides at that residence, were all actively looking for the two girls.

"Initially, it was discovered that they were just not where they should have been inside the home.”

Detective Bryan Wolfe added: “It was determined that there was a lack of supervision for the children.

“It allowed them to enter the vehicle and pass away."

Foster has been charged with second-degree murder and second-degree cruelty to children.

She also had custody of the twins' brothers, however they are now back with their biological parents after child services signed off on them.

The girls had been taken out of their mum and dad's care more than a year prior to their deaths.

Their biological mother Skye Keyes, who had visited the toddlers with her caseworker, said: "It’s a nightmare. It feels like a giant nightmare.

"I feel like we were the last ones to know our daughters died. No matter what, where was the woman watching them? It doesn’t make sense whatsoever."

Police said the foster family desperately searched for the girls when they could not be found inside their home, before looking in the back garden and surrounding neighborhood.

When they returned to the house they found the girls dead in the car.

Skye said she visited the girls every Friday along with their dad and a caseworker after they were placed in care.

The mum said the family had "been through a lot" after they lost an older daughter.
description: Claudette Foster handed herself into police after the twins were discovered in a car outside her fiancé's home in Hinesville, Georgia, US
